page.title: 01Choppington
page.content: The village of Choppington in Northumberland is quite small consisting of a council estate, a private housing estate, a few terraced houses, some bungalows for the elderly, a school, a church, a caravan site and a Community Centre or Welfare Hall. There are only 4 small shops within the village. The surrounding land is mainly farmland although between Choppington and the Industrial Estate at Barrington land reclamation is taking place. This area was once part of Barrington Coal Mine. It was also the area where clay was dug out for the once thriving brickworks which was the main industry before the mines were sunk. The main road which runs through Choppington leads north to Guidepost and south to Bedlington and the city of Newcastle.
